events.originalText: The Indonesian Navy submarine Nanggala sank with the loss of all 53 people on board.
events.subtitle: Indonesian Navy
events.headline: Indonesian Navy submarine Nanggala sinks, 53 people lost

events.originalText: The city of Flint, Michigan, U.S., changed its water source to the Flint River, which exposed residents to lead poisoning.
events.subtitle: Flint, Michigan
events.headline: Flint, Michigan changes water source to Flint River, lead poisoning exposed

events.originalText: Ukraine and Russia signed the Kharkiv Pact, extending the Russian lease on naval facilities in Crimea.
events.subtitle: Kharkiv Pact
events.headline: Ukraine and Russia sign Kharkiv Pact, extending Russian lease on naval facilities in Crimea

events.originalText: South Vietnamese  president Nguyễn Văn Thiệu resigned on hearing of the fall of Xuân Lộc, the last battle of the Vietnam War.
events.subtitle: South Vietnam
events.headline: South Vietnamese president Nguyễn Văn Thiệu resigns after fall of Xuân Lộc

events.originalText: In response to a dispute over wheat production quotas, Leonard Casley declared his 75 km2 (29 sq mi) farm in Western Australia to be an independent country as the Hutt River Province.
events.subtitle: Western Australia
events.headline: Leonard Casley declares farm in Western Australia as independent country

events.originalText: The Century 21 Exposition, the first world's fair in the United States since World War II, opened in Seattle.
events.subtitle: Century 21 Exposition
events.headline: Century 21 Exposition opens in Seattle, first world's fair in U.S. since WWII

events.originalText: United Airlines Flight 736 collided with a U.S. Air Force fighter jet over southern Nevada, resulting in the deaths of all 49 people on board both aircraft.
events.subtitle: United Air Lines Flight 736
events.headline: United Airlines Flight 736 collides with U.S. Air Force fighter jet, 49 people dead

events.originalText: The "Surgeon's Photograph", purportedly showing the Loch Ness Monster (later revealed to be a hoax), was published in the Daily Mail.
events.subtitle: Loch Ness Monster
events.headline: Loch Ness Monster hoax revealed, 'Surgeon's Photograph' published in Daily Mail

events.originalText: Forces of the Republic of Texas led by Sam Houston defeated the Mexican troops of General Antonio López de Santa Anna in the Battle of San Jacinto, the decisive and final battle of the Texas Revolution.
events.subtitle: Republic of Texas
events.headline: Sam Houston's forces defeat Mexican troops in Battle of San Jacinto

events.originalText: The Ladies of Trenton social club hosted a reception (depicted) for President-elect George Washington as he journeyed to New York City for his first inauguration.
events.subtitle: George Washington's reception at Trenton
events.headline: Ladies of Trenton host reception for President-elect George Washington

events.originalText: The Wignacourt Aqueduct (pictured) in Malta was inaugurated and was used to carry water to Valletta for about 300 years.
events.subtitle: Wignacourt Aqueduct
events.headline: Wignacourt Aqueduct in Malta inaugurated, used for 300 years

events.originalText: Henry VIII became King of England, following the death of his father Henry VII, eventually becoming a significant figure in the history of the English monarchy.
events.subtitle: Henry VIII
events.headline: Henry VIII becomes King of England after father's death

events.originalText: Ælfric of Abingdon was appointed Archbishop of Canterbury
events.subtitle: Ælfric of Abingdon
events.headline: Ælfric of Abingdon appointed Archbishop of Canterbury

events.originalText: A debt was pardoned by the chief of Tondo on the island of Luzon and recorded on the Laguna Copperplate Inscription, the earliest known calendar-dated document found in the Philippines.
events.subtitle: Tondo (historical polity)
events.headline: Debt pardoned by chief of Tondo recorded on Laguna Copperplate Inscription

events.originalText: Forces led by Mark Antony fought the Battle of Mutina against those of Decimus Brutus, one of Julius Caesar's assassins.
events.subtitle: Mark Antony
events.headline: Mark Antony's forces battle Decimus Brutus at Mutina

events.originalText: Romulus and Remus (depicted) legendarily founded the city of Rome, according to the calculations of ancient Roman scholar Varro Reatinus.
events.subtitle: Romulus and Remus
events.headline: Romulus and Remus legendarily found city of Rome
